page.title: 13Health Service in Torphichen
page.content: Torphichen suffers from a lack of medical services. The village has neither a doctor nor a chemist and the nearest health centre is Bathgate or Armadale. Every Tuesday a doctor from Armadale, which is about 6 miles away, comes out to the village. If anyone needs him a message is left in the Post Office. The doctor visits all the people on the list. If a prescription is required it is left at the Post Office and then sent to the chemist in Armadale. The medicine is sent through the post to Torphichen Post Office where it can be collected on the Thursday. If a child breaks his arm the nearest hopital is Bangour but because there is not a resident Paeditrician all they can do is x_ray the arm, put it in a sling and send the patient to Edinburgh or Leith which is about 20_25 miles away.
